pageContext.claim: “People aren't fighting for Israel in Congress, large numbers of people.”
pageContext.analysis: This is an odd remark — members of Congress represent Americans not Israelis. Regardless, the memorandum of understanding outlining U.S. foreign assistance to Israel was negotiated in 2016 and runs from fiscal year 2019 to fiscal year 2028. So, the current Congress has little to nothing to do with it. Under the MOU, the U.S. will send $38 billion in military aid to Israel, which is $8 billion more than the previous package.
